Comment: Queen's pawn opening, one of my favorites however, i was playing black so he had to make the move.
My most usual reply to a queen's pawn opening
Here, i took his Pawn, any top rated player would not recommend that, you will see the reason in the next move of white.
Here, i took his Pawn, any top rated player would not recommend that, you will see the reason in the next move of white.
Here, i took his Pawn, any top rated player would not recommend that, you will see the reason in the next move of white.
Here, i took his Pawn, any top rated player would not recommend that, you will see the reason in the next move of white.

Nc3. This move of white forces the black queen to move to a different square. As a result black wastes a move. White gets an advantage to develop his pieces faster than the black. I knew this thing before i played the game, still i made it. Well the blunder is yet to come.

Nc6??
This was the blunder i made. I didnt move my queen. This was a complete human error. I didnt notice that untill the next move.
As expected..
At this point my queen was gone. I felt weak..
White already had an upper hand at this stage. He was developing his pieces to finish up an already won game..
I knew he would definitely castle at a later stage in the game. At this point i was just expecting him to castle king side. Also i myself wanted to castle as soon as possible.
I knew he would definitely castle at a later stage in the game. At this point i was just expecting him to castle king side. Also i myself wanted to castle as soon as possible.
I knew he would definitely castle at a later stage in the game. At this point i was just expecting him to castle king side. Also i myself wanted to castle as soon as possible.
Another jolt for me. Anybody would do that. Its a simple phenomenon that if you are at an advantage in a game, trade off equal pieces, this makes the opponent weaker and yourself stronger.
I was lagging on pieces, and my pawn structure had also shattered. Anybody looking at the board would definitely say that i have lost the game.
Planning to castle..
Although, i had planned an attack towards his king side, but i knew i cant make a direct attack. Plus i also had in mind not to let him move his queen. I was safe as long as his queen was at d1.
Although, i had planned an attack towards his king side, but i knew i cant make a direct attack. Plus i also had in mind not to let him move his queen. I was safe as long as his queen was at d1.
Although, i had planned an attack towards his king side, but i knew i cant make a direct attack. Plus i also had in mind not to let him move his queen. I was safe as long as his queen was at d1.
He freed his rook which was pinned in the earlier move.. i expected this.
As i didnt have my queen, so i was bound to take the help of my rooks..

This was one wrong move he made. He had moved his pawn to a3 fearing my bishop attack at b4. However, he had other alternatives to defend his rook if i would have made that move. But this a3 move gave me an opportunity to launch a bishop-rook attack.

He made this move to free his pieces to launch an attack on me, however he made a mistake. His e4 pawn was supported by his knight at g3 and Rook at e1. I could easily take this e4 pawn by my Knight at f6, if i traded his g3 knight by my bishop at d6. But at this stage he would not have been expecting this, as he thought i would not afford to lose one more piece and that too a bishop (which are better in endgames than knights).

But at this stage he would not have been expecting this, as he thought i would not afford to lose one more piece and that too a bishop (which are better in endgames than knights).
But i took this and the sequence of moves followed, i had done this to gain a positional advantage in the game.
See, as i said positional advantage. I had launched an attack with a rook, bishop and a knight. And with all this i had some how restricted his queen's movement, thus not letting him make an attack.

He started feeling the threat of my attack, so wanted to break it by trading my rook. Another trading that anyone would happily do when in an advantage
